text:
Tried the seccond test on 4.1.18 and it won't work (that is, bug still present).
I also had this bug on a different cenario but have to build a small test case
to add.

Here my case, which I guess it's related to this same bug:

I enter a servlet using the default /servlet/* mapping, that is, the
nvokerServlet is enanled. This servlet forwards to a JSP page using a relative
path like "../page.jsp".

The first time the servlet is executed it gets a NullPointerException on
request.getRequestDispatcher. If you reload the page it works fine.

The servlet API states the dispatcher got from the request should be able to
handle relative paths. I have tons of servlets built this way and they worked
fine with jetty. I hope not having to change them all just to switch to tomcat. :-)
